meanings.definition: The action of setting something on fire or starting to burn.
meanings.sent1: The ignition of the campfire brought warmth to the chilly night.
meanings.sent2: The ignition of the candle filled the room with a pleasant scent.
meanings.sent3: After some failed attempts, the ignition of the barbecue finally happened.
meanings.sent4: His speech was the ignition that sparked a revolution in the country.
meanings.sent5: The ignition of the fireworks lit up the sky in a dazzling display.

meanings.definition: The process of starting the engine of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: She turned the key in the ignition to start the car.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic checked the ignition to ensure the car would start smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The ignition of the old truck always required a bit of patience.
meanings.sent4: The ignition of the motorcycle roared to life with a powerful sound.
meanings.sent5: Without the ignition, the car would just be a metal box on wheels.

meanings.definition: The act of igniting or causing something to catch fire.
meanings.sent1: The ignition of the match lit up the dark room.
meanings.sent2: His quick action prevented the ignition of the forest fire.
meanings.sent3: The ignition of the bonfire was met with cheers from the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The ignition of the stove signaled the start of dinner preparation.
meanings.sent5: The ignition of the rocket marked the beginning of the space mission.
